results.byline: By Salman Masood and Christina Goldbaum
results.title: Imran Khan, Ex-Prime Minister of Pakistan, Is Shot at Rally
results.abstract: Mr. Khan, who was leading a protest march, was wounded in both legs, in an attack that threated to plunge the country into turmoil.

results.byline: By Kate Conger, Ryan Mac and Tiffany Hsu
results.title: Elon Musk Takes a Page Out of Mark Zuckerberg’s Social Media Playbook
results.abstract: As Mr. Musk takes over Twitter, he is emulating some of the actions of Mr. Zuckerberg, who leads Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp.
org_facet: National Assn for the Advancement of Colored People

media.caption: Elon Musk in January 2020. As Twitter’s new owner, he met this week with civil rights groups.

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Capital Punishment;Mass Shootings;Parkland, Fla, Shooting (2018);Cruz, Nikolas
results.title: Parkland Gunman Gets 34 Life Sentences
results.abstract: The gunman who killed 17 people at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School was addressed directly by the families of his victims for the first time.

media.caption: Linda Beigel Schulman displayed a composite photo of the 17 murdered students and staff as she gave her victim impact statement on Wednesday. Her son, Scott Beigel, was killed in the 2018 mass shooting.
media.copyright: Pool photo by Amy Beth Bennett

results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Prices (Fares, Fees and Rates);Video Recordings, Downloads and Streaming;Computers and the Internet;Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures;Layoffs and Job Reductions;Corporate Social Responsibility;Advertising and Marketing;Musk, Elon;Twitter;San Francisco (Calif)
results.byline: By Mike Isaac and Ryan Mac
results.title: Elon Musk, Under Financial Pressure, Pushes to Make Money From Twitter
results.abstract: The billionaire and his advisers have discussed adding paid direct messages, fees to watch videos and other features to the service.

media.caption: Twitter’s headquarters in San Francisco. Last year, the company had less money in cash flow than what it now owes its lenders annually.

results.adx_keywords: Illegal Immigration;United States Politics and Government;Assaults;Depape, David;Pelosi, Paul;Pelosi, Nancy;Homeland Security Department;Immigration and Customs Enforcement (US);Canada
results.title: Suspect in Pelosi Attack Was in the U.S. Illegally, Officials Say
results.abstract: David DePape, a Canadian, legally entered the United States in 2008. He faces several state and federal charges after the authorities say he broke into Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s home and assaulted her husband.

media.caption: Police officers outside Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s home in San Francisco last week.

results.adx_keywords: Baseball;World Series;Javier, Cristian (1997- );Nola, Aaron (1993- );Montero, Rafael;Abreu, Bryan (1997- );Houston Astros;Philadelphia Phillies
results.title: Astros Combine for Second No-Hitter in World Series History
results.abstract: Cristian Javier and three relievers shut down the powerful Philadelphia Phillies, tying the World Series and accomplishing a feat that hadn’t happened since 1956.

media.caption: Houston’s Cristian Javier was dominant for six innings. He struck out nine, issued two walks and did not allow a hit. Three relievers finished off the first World Series no-hitter since Don Larsen’s perfect game for the Yankees in 1956.

results.adx_keywords: DNA (Deoxyribonucleic Acid);Forensic Science;Dunes;Genealogy;Missing Persons;Ancestry.com;Federal Bureau of Investigation;Cape Cod (Mass);Chattanooga (Tenn);Provincetown (Mass);Tennessee;Massachusetts
results.title: Nearly 50 Years After Murder, the ‘Lady of the Dunes’ Is Identified
results.abstract: A body found in 1974 in Massachusetts was that of Ruth Marie Terry of Tennessee, the F.B.I. said this week. Her identity had captivated New Englanders for decades.

media.caption: The remains of a long-unidentified woman known as the Lady of the Dunes were buried in St. Peter's Cemetery in Provincetown, Mass. Ms. Terry’s son now wants to rebury her next to her parents in Tennessee.
media.copyright: Merrily Cassidy/Cape Cod Times, via USA Today Network

results.adx_keywords: Assaults;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Compensation for Damages (Law);Demonstrations, Protests and Riots;Trump, Donald J;Trump Organization
results.title: Trump Settles With Protesters Who Said His Bodyguards Attacked Them
results.abstract: One of the demonstrators said a bodyguard struck him on the head outside Trump Tower in 2015. Terms of the deal were not released.

media.caption: Donald Trump said he knew little of the fracas, but that his bodyguard had torn up “a 50-cent sign.”
media.copyright: Rebecca Noble for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Soccer;World Cup 2022 (Soccer);United States Soccer Federation;Qatar
results.title: Qatar Offered Fans Free World Cup Trips, but Only on Its Terms
results.abstract: Organizers are providing travel and tickets to fans of the participating teams, including dozens of Americans. But only if they promised not to criticize Qatar, and to report people who do.

media.caption: Qatar will welcome fans from every corner of the world this month. Some will get special attention.

results.adx_keywords: Social Security (US);Medicare;Retirement;Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Democratic Party;Republican Party;House of Representatives;Senate
results.title: Republicans, Eyeing Majority, Float Changes to Social Security and Medicare
results.abstract: Democrats have seized on Republican proposals to limit retirement benefits to galvanize voters ahead of the midterm elections.

media.caption: Senator Rick Scott, Republican of Florida, has proposed subjecting nearly all federal spending programs to a renewal vote every year, which would make Medicare and Social Security more vulnerable to budget cuts.
media.copyright: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: internal-sub-only;Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Friendship;Domestic Service;Content Type: Personal Profile;Albuquerque (NM);New Mexico
results.title: She Bought the House Her Mother Cleaned for 43 Years
results.abstract: Nichol Naranjo says she was destined to own the house that was a refuge, “a place to come and catch our breath. And to dream.”

media.caption: Margaret Gaxiola, left, was once the housekeeper of the home that her daughter Nichol Naranjo, right, bought in 2020.
media.copyright: John Burcham for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Nudism and Nudity;Pornography;Indecency, Obscenity and Profanity;Social Media;Computers and the Internet;Tumblr;Automattic
results.title: Tumblr Says Clothing Is Optional Again
results.abstract: Reversing a 2018 ban, the company said that nudity and “mature subject matter” would be allowed. But “visual depictions of sexually explicit acts” remain off limits.

media.caption: The blogging site Tumblr lost about a third of its traffic after it announced in 2018 that it was banning explicit posts.
media.copyright: Thiago Prudencio/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images

results.title: Black Faith Leaders in Georgia Speak Out Against Herschel Walker
results.abstract: The group has long been a highly influential voice on politics in their communities and played a key role in mobilizing Black voters.

media.caption: Pastor Jamal Bryant delivered a sermon criticizing Herschel Walker that went viral this week.
media.copyright: Wulf Bradley for The New York Times

results.byline: By Jonah E. Bromwich, Maggie Haberman, Ben Protess and William K. Rashbaum
results.title: Trump Files a Suit Against N.Y.’s Attorney General, and Against Advice
results.abstract: The case, filed in Florida, seeks to stop Letitia James’s lawsuit in New York and includes Mr. Trump’s signature rhetoric. His legal advisers are split on the wisdom of filing it.

media.caption: The Florida suit includes boasts about the former president’s business and insults directed at his opponents.
media.copyright: Brittany Greeson for The New York Times

results.byline: By Choe Sang-Hun and Motoko Rich
results.title: North Korea Fires 6 More Missiles Toward Japan, Including an ICBM
results.abstract: A day after launching nearly two dozen missiles, the North fired more. One was an intercontinental ballistic missile, but that test apparently failed, an official said.

media.caption: Japan’s nationwide J-Alert system broadcasting emergency information in Tokyo, after North Korea fired ballistic missiles on Thursday morning.

results.title: Nets Suspend Kyrie Irving Indefinitely After Antisemitic Movie Post

results.title: Trump Lawyer Expressed Worry Over False Claims of Election Fraud
results.abstract: John Eastman also suggested in a newly disclosed batch of emails that getting the case in front of Justice Clarence Thomas would be the most likely route to delaying certification of the 2020 results in Georgia.

media.caption: John Eastman appeared onscreen in June during a hearing by the House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol.

results.adx_keywords: Boxing;Drug Abuse and Traffic;Cocaine and Crack Cocaine;Smuggling;Maritime Crime;Ships and Shipping;Ports;Gogic, Goran;Colombia;Europe;United States
results.title: Former Heavyweight Boxer Charged With Trafficking $1 Billion of Cocaine
results.abstract: Goran Gogic helped move vast amounts of cocaine from Colombia to Europe using U.S. ports, prosecutors said. One haul was among the largest cocaine seizures in U.S. history, they said.

media.caption: Goran Gogic, a former heavyweight boxer, was charged with trafficking over 20 tons of cocaine estimated to be worth more than $1 billion, prosecutors said.

results.title: Justice Dept. Offers Immunity to Trump Aide for Testimony in Documents Case
results.abstract: The adviser, Kash Patel, had previously declined to answer questions from prosecutors in front of a federal grand jury, citing his Fifth Amendment rights.

media.caption: Kash Patel, a close adviser to former President Donald J. Trump, was offered a grant of immunity by prosecutors for his testimony.

results.title: Obama casts Arizona’s midterm election as a fight to preserve democracy.
results.abstract: Mr. Obama was again interrupted at a rally and he used the off-script exchange as a teachable moment.
